III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Section written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/30/24, Youth A was attempting to play with Supervisor
outside and grabbed the Supervisor glove. The Supervisor flung
their arm up and hit Youth A in the face. It is unknown if this was
accidental. Youth A was not injured. Youth A went into the cottage
and destroyed part of the property. Youth A was outside and not
allowed to go inside the cottage until 11:30pm.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
05/10/2024.
Interviews:
I contacted the Complainant on 05/10/2024 and no additional
information was provided.
I spoke with Juvenile Justice (JJ) Worker on 05/10/2024 via
telephone. JJ Worker reported she was informed of the incident
on 04/30/2024 when Youth A had AWOLed on campus.
I interviewed Director on 05/13/2024 at the agency. Director
reported Youth A has been at the agency for over one year and a
30-day letter was submitted on 03/08/24. Youth A has a history of
AWOLing, substance abuse, assaulting staff, destroying property,
and assaulting peers. On 04/30/2024 Youth A AWOLed around
7:30pm and returned to campus 30 minutes later escalated.
Director was informed by Supervisor, that Supervisor sat with
Youth A outside the cottage until Youth A calmed down, but Youth
A refused to allow Supervisor to search him. Supervisor offered
Youth A the option to go to the administrative building or the gym,
but Youth A refused. Supervisor and Youth A sat outside the
cottage till around 11:00pm, Youth A agreed to allow Supervisor to
search him and Youth A was allowed back in the cottage without
further incident.
2

I interviewed Youth A on 05/13/2024 at the agency. Youth A is 16
years old and has been at the agency for 16 months. Youth A
admitted he AWOLed on 04/30/2024 and walked around the
campus for about 30 minutes. Youth A said when he returned to
campus Supervisor sat with him outside the cottage and tried to
talk to him, but Youth A didn’t want to talk. Youth A said he was
playing around with Supervisor and tried to take his gloves and
hat. He said Supervisor put his hand up blocking him from taking
his hat and his hand brushed against Youth A’s face. Youth A
denied Supervisor hit him in the face or intentionally brushed him
and he did return to campus. Youth A said he sat outside with
Supervisor for several hours, but Supervisor did offer him to go to
the gym or the office building. He admitted he was agitated and
chose to stay outside with Supervisor.
I interviewed Supervisor at the agency on 05/13/2024. Supervisor
has been working at the agency for 7 years. Supervisor reported
on 04/30/2024 Youth A had AWOLed and when he returned to
campus, he was outside with Youth A. Youth A was agitated and
refused to be searched. Youth A has a history of substance abuse
and being assaultive with staff and his peers. Supervisor sat with
Youth A outside the cottage and was trying to get him to calm
down, he suggested they go to the gym or the administrative
building, but Youth A refused to go. Supervisor sat outside the
cottage with Youth A for a couple of hours until he calmed down
and agreed to be searched. Supervisor said at one point Youth A
reached over and tried to grab his hat and he put up his hand
trying to block Youth A from grabbing his hat. Supervisor’s hand
brushed against Youth A’s face. Supervisor denied hitting or
intentionally touching Youth A’s face. Supervisor said he moved
away from Youth A after this, but stayed with Youth A outside until
Youth A calmed down and went back to the cottage.
I interviewed Staff on 06/04/2024 at the agency on 06/04/2024.
Staff is a shift leader and was working the evening in question.
Staff said Youth A refused to be searched and therefore
Supervisor sat with Youth A outside until Youth A agreed to be
searched. Staff denied witnessing Supervisor hit or touch Youth A
while they were outside. Staff reported all youths must be
searched when they return after they AWOL.
Video Review:
Video footage from 04/30/2024 was reviewed on 05/13/2024
(Note: video has no audio). Supervisor is observed sitting on the
bench outside the cottage, Youth A was standing facing
3

Supervisor. Youth A attempted to grab Supervisor’s cap,
Supervisor put his hand up blocking Youth A’s hand, Supervisor’s
hand touched Youth A’s face. Supervisor stood up and moved
away from Youth A.
Documentation Review:
• Incident report dated 04/30/2024, written by Supervisor.
Incident report is consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Personnel file for Supervisor: no disciplinary action.
• Youth A 30-day letter dated 03/08/2024. Over the course of
thirteen months, Youth A’s behaviors have increased and
become more unstable. Youth A requires constant
redirection and 1:1 supervision, when on campus. Even
with this 1:1 supervision, Youth A continues to engage in
behaviors that put himself, his peers, and the staff that is
working with him in danger. Youth A’s physical aggression
has led to him being placed in a Detention Facility.
Youth A has been arrested for physically assaulting a staff
resulting in the staff having to take time off work due to the
injuries. Recently Youth A struck another youth so hard in
the eye and ear that the youth required multiple visits with
our campus nurse and urgent care. Youth A regularly
AWOLs from campus and his school to utilize substances
and returns combative. He refuses to utilize the
interventions created with him in individual therapy and is
resistant to the multiple interventions that have been
provided to him.
• Agency Search Policy: All residents: can be searched upon
return to campus upon return from AWOL.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage, and
documentations reviewed, there is insufficient evidence to support
the allegations staff hit Youth A. Staff and Youth interviewed
denied staff hit youth. Youth A AWOLed on 04/30/2024 and when
he returned to campus he refused to be searched, documentation
and staff interviews confirmed staff followed facility’s policy
regarding Youth A AWOLing and refusing to be searched.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
